author: Anonym
title: Conditions for President Tebboune's visit to France are not met, says Algeria - Teller Report
text: Conditions for President Tebboune's visit to France are not met, says Algeria Algerian President Abdelmajid Tebboune's state visit to France has already been postponed twice to 2023. It was supposed to take place in early 2024, but it "is still being prepared," Algerian Foreign Minister Ahmed Attaf said on December 27. Algiers still finds that the conditions for carrying out this visit are not met. This depends on the resolution of five major issues that are still being debated. Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune in Algiers on August 27, 2022. (Illustrative photo) AFP - LUDOVIC MARIN By: RFI Follow Advertising Read More This visit was supposed to confirm the improvement between the two countries, after many diplomatic crises. But the conditions are still not met, and Algiers is making it clear this time through its foreign minister, Ahmed Attaf. The latter affirmed this in an interview given on Wednesday evening 27 December to the podcast platform Atheer, owned by the Qatari channel Al-Jazeera. "We have not reached agreements on five major and heavy issues," said the Algerian foreign minister, who added, however, that work continues and that visits between officials of the two countries are continuing. Among these pending files is the one on French nuclear tests in the Algerian Sahara. France carried out 17 of them between 1960 and 1966 at the Reggane site, then at In Ekker. Documents declassified in 2013 spoke of significant radioactive effects that spread from West Africa to southern Europe. Algeria is asking for "recognition of the damage it has suffered as a result of its tests", as well as compensation. Also, France still refuses, according to Algiers, to hand over the sword and burnous of Emir Abdelkader, arguing the need for a law, says the Algerian diplomat. However, according to the programme of the visit, President Tebboune was to go to the castle of Ambroise, where Abdelkader was imprisoned. The other two files concern mobility and visa issues between the two countries, as well as economic cooperation. Read alsoAlgeria: President Tebboune takes stock of his four years in power NewsletterGet all the latest international news straight to your inbox Subscribe now Follow all the international news by downloading the RFI app Share: Read on the same topics: - France - Algeria - Abdelmadjid Tebboune - Diplomacy

author: come-on.de
title: Meghan Markles „magische Blumenstreusel" bieten Steilvorlage für lustige Parodien
text:
Meghan Markles „magische Blumenstreusel“ bieten Steilvorlage für lustige Parodien
Mit ihren fragwürdigen Lifestyle-Tipps sorgte Meghan Markle zuletzt für hämische Kommentare. Während eines Auftritts verteidigte die Herzogin jetzt unter anderem ihre vielfach kritisierte Blumendeko.
New York – Ihre Netflix-Show „With Love, Meghan“ sollte Meghan Markle (43) eigentlich als Expertin in Lifestyle-Fragen etablieren. Der Versuch ging jedoch ziemlich nach hinten los, denn die Ehefrau von Prinz Harry (40) machte sich mit ihren seltsam anmutenden Küchentipps in den sozialen Netzwerken zum Gespött der Zuschauer. Insbesondere die essbaren getrockneten Blüten, die laut Meghan selbst den einfachsten Gerichten einen Gourmet-Anstrich verleihen, führten im Netz zu zahlreichen Parodien.
Meghans „magische Blumenstreusel“ sorgen für Lacher auf Social Media
Eines steht fest: „With Love, Meghan“ hat die Herzogin von Sussex zweifelsohne wieder einmal ins Gespräch gebracht. Seit der Veröffentlichung der Netflix-Produktion häufen sich die Satire-Posts auf Instagram, TikTok und Co., wobei vor allem die „magischen Blumenstreusel“ der zweifachen Mutter für Kopfschütteln sorgen. Bei der fraglichen Essensdeko handelt es sich um getrocknete Blüten, die Meghan liebend gerne über Rührei, Salate und Joghurtspeisen streut.
Dass sie selbst ganz und gar überzeugt von der beeindruckenden Wirkung ihrer essbaren Blumen ist, veranlasste seitdem zahlreiche Social-Media-Nutzer zu Parodien von „With Love, Meghan“. Kurzerhand werden Blütenblätter jetzt über alles gestreut – auch auf das Butterbrot. Während eines öffentlichen Auftritts in New York verteidigte Meghan ihre „magischen Blumenstreusel“ jetzt jedoch vehement.
Laut Meghan sind die getrockneten Blüten mehr als nur Deko auf dem Teller
Beim „Time100“-Gipfel bezeichnete Meghan Markle ihre vielfach kritisierten Blütenstreusel als eine Art „Analogie“, denn laut der Herzogin stehen die essbaren Blumen für mehr als nur Deko. „Lasst uns über die Blumenstreusel reden“, erklärte Meghan „The Daily Beast“-Berichten zufolge im Gespräch mit „Time“-CEO Jessica Sibley, „denn ich glaube es geht um die kleinen Momente der Freude, die so mühelos sind und einfach das kleine bisschen Magie erschaffen, nach dem wir uns alle in unserem Alltag sehnen.“
Offenbar scheint Meghan also eine regelrechte Philosophie in ihren Blumenstreuseln zu sehen. Dass zahlreiche Social-Media-User anderer Meinung sind, interessiert die Ex-Schauspielerin dagegen nur wenig. Angesprochen auf die Parodien im Netz, entgegnete sie amüsiert mit einem Zitat der Komikerin Tina Fey (54): „Wenn du jemals anfängst zufrieden mit dir zu sein, gibt es dieses Ding namens Internet, da kannst du viele Menschen finden, die dich nicht mögen.“ In Zukunft könnten Meghan Markle und Prinz Harry übrigens ihre Titel verlieren. Verwendete Quellen: thedailybeast.com, TikTok

author: Doc Louallen
title: Washington man bear sprays carjackers to protect his mother: Police
text: Man bear sprays carjackers to protect his 72-year-old mother, Washington State Police say [Doc Louallen](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7686036002/doc-louallen/) A Washington man used bear spray to fend off two attackers who attempted to carjack his elderly mother on Tuesday, bringing an end to a crime spree that included multiple carjackings and police chases, authorities said. "One of the suspects tried taking the elderly lady out of the driver seat but the woman made it hard for him to close the door," said Washington State Patrol Trooper Rick Johnson. "Her son, who was parked next to her, came around and sprayed bear mace." The woman's son [told KOMO News](https://komonews.com/news/local/bear-spray-thwarts-post-christmas-carjacking-at-sea-tac-rest-area-by-2-suspects-on-the-run-stolen-vehicle-i-5-police-washington-state-patrol-troopers-james-crime-protection-chelsea-dehart-criminal-holidays) he tried to stop a suspect by spraying him in the face with bear spray, but it didn't initially seem to phase the man. After it didn't work, the suspect got inside the victim's car but was unable to drive away because the victim had the keys in his pocket, according to investigators. "His face was all red and he was crying," the man told KOMO News. "His girlfriend asked me what I sprayed with and I sprayed her in the face, too." The two suspects, believed to be a man and a woman in their 30s, were arrested as Federal Way police arrived at the scene, KOMO News reported. The suspects face charges of eluding police, carjacking, and hit and run, according Johnson. Moments before the suspects were arrested According to the investigators, two suspects were eluding Kent police in a stolen vehicle driving northbound on Interstate 5. After a short time chasing after the stolen car, Kent police stopped their pursuit due to strict laws in Washington about officers in high-speed chases. Kent police officers reported the suspects hit multiple cars as they were escaping. The suspects lost control of their vehicle and stopped at a rest area off I-5 in Federal Way, nearly 8 miles north of their first encounter with Kent police. The suspects tried to break into three cars while at the rest stop, state investigators said. One of the suspects opened 72-year-old woman's car door, leading to the bear spray encounter. Investigators said none of the victims suffered serious injuries as the suspects tried stealing the cars. "I never thought something like this would happen to me, you see stuff all the time," the woman's son told KOMO News, "He's lucky I had bear spray otherwise I would have knocked him to the ground."

author: 许聃
title: "生态绿"变身产业聚集"聚宝盆" 增"绿"添"彩"筑牢绿色生态屏障 - 中国日报网
text:
央视网消息：3月12日是植树节。连日来，各地开展植树活动并持续做好防沙治沙工作，为春天增绿添彩，筑牢绿色生态屏障。
新疆喀什：固沙筑防线 推进荒漠化综合治理
在新疆喀什岳普湖县巴依阿瓦提乡，村民们正忙着铺设滴灌带。随着流动沙丘被推平整治，一条300米宽的梭梭林生态隔离带已现雏形。在滴灌带铺设、水泵安装、电网等基本工作完成后，这里就可以开始种植梭梭。
据了解，岳普湖县地处塔克拉玛干沙漠的西缘，风沙侵袭制约着当地的发展。近年来，县里在防沙治沙的同时，还因地制宜发展梭梭嫁接肉苁蓉的特色沙产业，通过探索“生态+经济”的治沙模式，实现防沙治沙、改善生态环境与经济协同发展。
江苏靖江：连续16年公益植树为城市添绿
植树节到来之际，在江苏省靖江市靖城街道东南村生态修复项目现场，2000多名志愿者分工协作，栽种近700株桂花、香樟等苗木。树苗被成功栽种后，大家为每一颗树苗挂上了专属的“爱心牌”。
据了解，当地爱心认种的公益植树活动已持续举行了16年，共筹得92.7万元爱心认种款，750余名有困难的学生因此获得帮扶。
重庆：生态修复让烂泥沟变身美丽公园
在重庆市高新区白市驿镇望月湖畔，当地组织干部群众共同种下上千株树苗。据了解，望月湖一带曾被当地村民称为“烂泥沟山坪塘”，生态环境糟糕。
近年来，白市驿镇持续对望月湖实施生态修复与功能提升工程，同步推进水体净化与景观绿化。如今的望月湖，已成为周边群众休闲健身、游客观光“打卡”的热门地。环湖健身步道、太阳能路灯等设施不仅改善了人居环境，更带动了当地的乡村旅游发展，此次的义务植树将使公园再添新绿。

author: @@SNB3112
title: So it's the Pixel Tablet 2 that is getting canceled and not the Pixel Tablet 3
text:
It was reported on Thursday that Google has [axed the development of the Pixel Tablet 3](https://www.neowin.net/news/google-reportedly-canceled-pixel-tablet-3-development/) and the Pixel Tablet 2 will be the company's last effort in the tablet industry, for the foreseeable future. Now, it is learned that it is the Pixel Tablet 2 that is seemingly getting axed and not the Pixel Tablet 3.
As per Android Authority (citing sources close to the matter), the Pixel Tablet 2 — which was recently leaked to be under development — is the device [that Google has decided to shelve](https://www.androidauthority.com/pixel-tablet-2-canceled-3502094/). The decision was reportedly driven by concerns about potential financial losses.
Recently, details about a new tablet, presumed to be the Pixel Tablet 2, hinted at features such as [upgraded cameras, a new Tensor chipset](https://www.neowin.net/news/google-tipped-to-be-working-on-the-pixel-tablet-2-with-an-upgraded-chipset-and-camera/), and reduced bezels on the front. It was also tipped that Google might also launch the official keyboard case for the tablet. However, it now appears the tablet in question was mistakenly identified as Pixel Tablet 3.
Moreover, the alleged code name "Kiyomi," initially coined for the Pixel Tablet 3 in [a previous report,](https://www.androidheadlines.com/exclusive-google-cancels-pixel-tablet-3-development) is said to actually refer to the Pixel Tabelt 2, as per Android Authority's sources. The sources suggest that the Pixel Tablet 2 is still in the early stages of development, and rumors about the Pixel Tablet 3 getting canceled are premature, as Google may have not even started working on the Tablet 3.
The Pixel Tablet 2 was rumored to launch in both Wi-Fi only and 5G models. While the company may have axed the development of Pixel Tablet 2, there are chances that Pixel Tablet 3 could still be in the works, or at least the company would consider it in the future.
